text: Tim Page (25 May 1944 â€“ 24 August 2022) was an English-born Australian photojournalist. He became popular during the Vietnam War for his photographs. He was born in Tunbridge Wells, England but was raised in Brisbane, Australia. He was a war correspondent for the Rolling Stone. Page died on 24 August 2022 from liver cancer at his home in New South Wales, Australia at the age of 78.Tim Page, Gonzo Photographer of Vietnam War, Is Dead at 78 ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2022 deaths Category:English photographers Category:Australian journalists Category:English journalists Category:Writers from Brisbane Category:War correspondents Category:Writers from Kent Category:Deaths from liver cancer
title: Tim Page
